quotes: In April 2019, Stoltenberg warned in a joint session of the U.S. Congress of the threat posed by Russia.
In May 2019, Stoltenberg hailed Turkey's contribution to NATO.
In August 2019, Stoltenberg warned that NATO needs to 'address the rise of China', by closely cooperating with Australia, New Zealand, Japan and South Korea.
In June 2020, Stoltenberg urged like-minded nations to stand up to China's 'bullying and coercion'.
In October 2019, Turkey invaded the Kurdish areas in Syria. Stoltenberg said that Turkey has 'legitimate security concerns' during press conference with Turkish FM Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu.

In December 2019, Stoltenberg told journalists in Brussels that 'Since 2016, Canada and European allies have added $130 billion more to the defense budgets, and this number will increase to 400 billion U.S. dollars by 2024. This is unprecedented. This is making NATO stronger.'
Stoltenberg visits a Dutch airbase hosting NATO deterrence exercise in October 2020.

Stoltenberg said, following a meeting on 6 January, 'all members of the Atlantic alliance stood behind the United States in the Middle East' and that 'Iran must refrain from further violence and provocations.'
On 14 February Stoltenberg opened the Munich Security Conference.

roles.title: secretary-general
quotes: He said: 'Turkey joined the Alliance in 1952, and it continues to be a highly valued member of our family of nations. As secretary-general, I greatly appreciate all that Turkey does for our Alliance.'
In May 2019, Stoltenberg hailed Turkey's contribution to NATO.
In October 2019, Turkey invaded the Kurdish areas in Syria. Stoltenberg said that Turkey has 'legitimate security concerns' during press conference with Turkish FM Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu.
In August 2019, Stoltenberg warned that NATO needs to 'address the rise of China', by closely cooperating with Australia, New Zealand, Japan and South Korea.

Stoltenberg 'strongly condemned' the 2019 Abqaiq–Khurais attack on key Saudi Arabia's oil facilities and accused Iran of 'supporting different terrorist groups and being responsible for destabilising the whole region.'
Stoltenberg speaks on Verkhovna Rada. Ukraine. 2019 Foto: Vadim Chuprina
In October 2019, Turkey invaded the Kurdish areas in Syria. Stoltenberg said that Turkey has 'legitimate security concerns' during press conference with Turkish FM Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu.

In December 2019, Stoltenberg told journalists in Brussels that 'Since 2016, Canada and European allies have added $130 billion more to the defense budgets, and this number will increase to 400 billion U.S. dollars by 2024. This is unprecedented. This is making NATO stronger.'

Stoltenberg said, following a meeting on 6 January, 'all members of the Atlantic alliance stood behind the United States in the Middle East' and that 'Iran must refrain from further violence and provocations.'

On 14 February Stoltenberg opened the Munich Security Conference. Amongst the topics he chose to address were Donald Trump's call for the European allies to contribute more funds to the common military good, the situation in Afghanistan which he promised not to leave, and the desire of Russia to reimagine the world in terms of the spheres of influence of the post-war years of the 20th century.

supporting_quotes: He said: 'Turkey joined the Alliance in 1952, and it continues to be a highly valued member of our family of nations. As secretary-general, I greatly appreciate all that Turkey does for our Alliance.'
assembled_events.notes: The role of secretary-general at NATO is clearly a career position with ongoing responsibilities.
